intro: Sphaerosicyos meyeri, commonly known as the African snail vine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and distinctive, fleshy, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered with a fine, velvety pubescence. Sphaerosicyos meyeri is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing along rocky outcrops or in dry woodlands.
